SEARCH
Package gw.api.intentionallogging

Interface IntentionalLogger

All Known Implementing Classes:
IntentionalLoggerImpl, NoOperatingIntentionalLogger
public interface IntentionalLogger
This interface is intended to record event oriented logs. Produced logs always contain the context of an operation being processed. The convention defined with this interface is primarily focused on standardizing and improving logs to make OPS-ing much easier. There are two types of events: - Lifecycle Events - that record the lifecycle of the operation, - Subsequent Events - that record any error, event or important detail that happened in the meantime.

Intentional logging implementation relies on org.slf4j.Marker class a lot (e.g. logging events, configuration). It assumes that a specific implementation of this interface in use has equals and hashcode methods in place which are in line with documentation in org.slf4j.Marker.

    • logErrorUnconditionally

      default void logErrorUnconditionally(org.slf4j.Marker operation, String message, Throwable t, LogMessageParams params)
      Logs an error occurrence without considering whether the associated marker is turned on. This would usually be a simple interface method, but since this is a public interface, adding this the normal way would be a breaking change.
      Parameters:
      operation - - marker that uniquely identifies an operation during which an error has occurred
      message - - message describing an error
      t - - error that has occurred
      params - - additional parameters

    • logDebugEvent

      void logDebugEvent(@NotNull @NotNull org.slf4j.Marker operation, @NotNull @NotNull Supplier<@NotNull String> messageSupplier, Supplier<LogMessageParams> paramsSupplier)
      Logs detailed event on DEBUG level
      Parameters:
      operation - - marker that uniquely identifies an operation
      messageSupplier - - supplier of message describing an event. Note Supplier.get() must return non-null
      paramsSupplier - - supplier of additional parameters. Note Supplier.get() must return non-null
